title: About appifyr
text: currently two packages allow useRs build web apps R: Shiny OpenCPU. drawbacks. Shiny makes simple create inputs outputs, requires useR write Shiny specific code. hand, OpenCPU provide boilerplate functions create input output elements. , useRs need write JavaScript html create functional app. However, OpenCPU independent platform can scaled without using proprietary Shiny Server Pro. appifyr comes . tries make OpenCPU engine accessible useRs little none knowledge JavaScript html. Appifyr makes easy build apps. Appifyr takes package functions functions rmarkdown document (experimental) turns app. using JavaScript html templates. function arguments linked html-form input. Appifyr creates html-id-tags identify form-input. click submit values read form request sent OpenCPU server. OpenCPU server runs R-code. R-function’s output handled Javascript callback displayed user. video shows timelapse workflow (R-markdown)

title: About appifyr
text: First, need install remotes CRAN. Second, install appifyr. fair amount package dependencies right, installed automatically. Third, install OpenCPU. bunch dependencies. using Ubuntu/Debian might install additional system libraries.

title: About appifyr
text: want create app appifyr creating R-package. Appifyr just writes Javascript html . app runs OpenCPU server. OpenCPU can make package functions available. excellent resources learn R-package, favorite one Hadley Wickhams R-Package book. ’s good idea familiarize basics writing R-package. Currently appifyr supports plots return value. flexibel input definitions. support Rmarkdown R-package conversion experimental. cases work, e.g. can’t read file like normally can access variables global environment. function needs self-contained. reliable behavior might want write function directly R-package functions (R/) save data .Rda files package’s data/ directory. use template created appifyr delete code Rmarkdown index file. writing functions package functions (R/) directory use build_app() build app use roxygen2 commenting style.

title: About appifyr
text: learn use appifyr head Sepals Petals. ’s app created appifyr runs OpenCPU cloud server. lot examples. ’s also good idea look Sepals Petals code Github. functions written R-package style. Feel free clone use template app.  Publishing app OpenCPU cloud server simple. need set webhook Github repo: Instructions.

what: A few words about appifyr’s magic
title: About appifyr
text: appify function generates html. call appify Rmarkdown document raw html output appify included final html document rendered knitr. can hide R-code-chunk interested showing code.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Reto Wyss. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. Michael Rustler. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wyss R (2025). appifyr: Create Web Applications R Functions. R package version 0.2.0, https://github.com/retowyss/appifyr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {appifyr: Create Web Applications from R Functions},   author = {Reto Wyss},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://github.com/retowyss/appifyr}, }

what: Create Web Applications from R Functions (Updated May 2025)
title: appifyr
text: Turn R functions interactive web applications minimal code! appifyr bridges gap R’s analytical capabilities web interfaces : Taking regular R functions Automatically generating HTML forms function parameters Connecting inputs OpenCPU API calls Displaying function outputs (currently plots)

title: appifyr
code: # Install the package install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("retowyss/appifyr")  # Create a simple function histogram_app <- function(n, bins) {   hist(rnorm(n), breaks = bins, main = "Random Normal Distribution") }  # Create a web interface for your function library(appifyr) app <- appify(   f = "histogram_app",    inps = list(     n = inp_number(from = 10, to = 1000, label = "Sample Size"),     bins = inp_number(from = 5, to = 30, label = "Number of Bins")   ) )  # To run the app, you'll need OpenCPU # install.packages("opencpu") # opencpu::ocpu_start_app("YourPackageName")

title: appifyr
text: appifyr uses OpenCPU backend create web interfaces R functions. Unlike Shiny, requires learning Shiny-specific syntax, appifyr works regular R functions requires minimal JavaScript/HTML knowledge.

title: appifyr
text: Shiny: start goal creating specific app write R code achieve goal. appifyr: start existing R code create app visualize function.

title: appifyr
text: Appifyr Documentation Demo App - Sepals Petals

title: appifyr
text: run apps created appifyr, need OpenCPU:
code: # Install OpenCPU install.packages("opencpu")  # Clone the demo application # git clone https://github.com/retowyss/sepals-and-petals.git  # Build and start the app appifyr::build_app() opencpu::ocpu_start_app("SepalsAndPetals")

title: appifyr
text: Simple API: main function appify() takes R function specifications inputs Intuitive Input Creation: Helper functions like inp_text(), inp_number(), inp_dropdown() Built-Web Components: Generates Bootstrap-styled form elements layout Integration OpenCPU: Uses OpenCPU JavaScript library handle API calls

what: Create App From Function and Inputs — appify
title: Create App From Function and Inputs — appify
Create App From Function and Inputs — appify
code: appify(f, inps, out = "plot", id = NULL, theme = "bootstrap4")

title: Create App From Function and Inputs — appify
text: f function string inps list inputs, see ?inp_text, ?inp_number ?inp_dropdown output type (currently valid value "plot", "table" planned future releases) id html identifier, NULL id generated randomly. set id manually, make sure unique. theme CSS framework use. Currently "bootstrap4" supported.

title: Create App From Function and Inputs — appify
text: object class "appifyr_app" containing HTML components   can included R Markdown documents Shiny applications.

title: Create App From Function and Inputs — appify
code: # Simple histogram function # hist_fun <- function(n, bins) { #   hist(rnorm(n), breaks = bins) # } #  # Create app with numeric inputs app <- appify(   f = "hist_fun",    inps = list(     n = inp_number(from = 10, to = 1000, label = "Sample Size"),     bins = inp_number(from = 5, to = 30, label = "Number of Bins")   ) )

what: appifyr: Create Web Applications from R Functions — appifyr-package
title: appifyr: Create Web Applications from R Functions — appifyr-package
text: appifyr package enables R users create interactive web applications using OpenCPU backend. provides bridge R's analytical capabilities web interfaces automatically generating HTML forms function parameters, connecting inputs OpenCPU API calls, displaying function outputs. learn appifyr, start vignettes: `browseVignettes(package = "appifyr")`

title: appifyr: Create Web Applications from R Functions — appifyr-package
text: appify: Create web app R function inp_text: Create text input element inp_number: Create numeric input element inp_dropdown: Create dropdown/select input element build_app: Build install application

title: appifyr: Create Web Applications from R Functions — appifyr-package
text: Maintainer: Reto Wyss reto.wyss.ch@gmail.com [copyright holder] contributors: Michael Rustler michael.rustler@kompetenz-wasser.de (ORCID) [contributor]

what: Build and Install an appifyr Application — build_app
title: Build and Install an appifyr Application — build_app
text: function builds appifyr application rendering R Markdown site, documenting package, installing use OpenCPU.

title: Build and Install an appifyr Application — build_app
code: build_app(   app_dir = "app/website",   document = TRUE,   install = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Build and Install an appifyr Application — build_app
text: app_dir Path app directory (default: "app/website") document Logical; whether run roxygen2 documentation (default: TRUE) install Logical; whether install package (default: TRUE) quiet Logical; whether suppress output messages (default: FALSE)

title: Build and Install an appifyr Application — build_app
Build and Install an appifyr Application — build_app
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Build the app with default settings build_app()  # Build without installing build_app(install = FALSE)  # Build a specific app directory build_app("my_custom_app/website") } # }

title: Create a Random Id — create_id
text: Creates random identifier -zA-Z. function   used internally generate unique identifiers HTML elements.

title: Create a Random Id — create_id
text: n Length id (default: 10) prefix Optional prefix add random ID

title: Ensure Id Postfix — ensure_id_postfix
text: Ensures ID postfix available, either using   provided value generating random one.

title: Ensure Id Postfix — ensure_id_postfix
text: postfix Character string set user, else NULL

title: Ensure Id Postfix — ensure_id_postfix
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Returns a random ID ensure_id_postfix(NULL)  # Returns "myid" ensure_id_postfix("myid") } # }

title: Dropdown Input Form Group — inp_dropdown
text: kv vector, list dataframe label label form input - default display name variable width form-group's width bootstrap grid units ... additional arguments passed form group parser

title: Dropdown Input Form Group — inp_dropdown
code: inp_dropdown(c(1, 3, 7, 42)) #> $fg #> [1] "dropdown" #>  #> $label #> NULL #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> $opts #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>     key value #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1     1 #> 2     3     3 #> 3     7     7 #> 4    42    42 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"          "appifyr_dropdown_input" inp_dropdown(names(iris), label = "Select Iris Variable") #> $fg #> [1] "dropdown" #>  #> $label #> [1] "Select Iris Variable" #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> $opts #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   key          value        #>   <chr>        <chr>        #> 1 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length #> 2 Sepal.Width  Sepal.Width  #> 3 Petal.Length Petal.Length #> 4 Petal.Width  Petal.Width  #> 5 Species      Species      #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"          "appifyr_dropdown_input" kv <- data.frame(key = c("A", "B"), value = c(1, 2)) inp_dropdown(kv) #> $fg #> [1] "dropdown" #>  #> $label #> NULL #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> $opts #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   key   value #>   <chr> <dbl> #> 1 A         1 #> 2 B         2 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"          "appifyr_dropdown_input" inp_dropdown(LETTERS, label = "Letters", width = 2) #> $fg #> [1] "dropdown" #>  #> $label #> [1] "Letters" #>  #> $width #> [1] 2 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> $opts #> # A tibble: 26 × 2 #>    key   value #>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 A     A     #>  2 B     B     #>  3 C     C     #>  4 D     D     #>  5 E     E     #>  6 F     F     #>  7 G     G     #>  8 H     H     #>  9 I     I     #> 10 J     J     #> # ℹ 16 more rows #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"          "appifyr_dropdown_input" inp_dropdown(list(n = 1, m = 2, k = 4)) #> $fg #> [1] "dropdown" #>  #> $label #> NULL #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> $opts #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   key   value #>   <chr> <dbl> #> 1 n         1 #> 2 m         2 #> 3 k         4 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"          "appifyr_dropdown_input"

text: number number step step size number input label label form input - default display name variable width form-group's width bootstrap grid units ... additional arguments passed form group parser

title: Number Input Form Group — inp_number
code: inp_number() #> $fg #> [1] "number" #>  #> $label #> NULL #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $opts #> $opts$from #> [1] 0 #>  #> $opts$to #> [1] 100 #>  #> $opts$step #> [1] 1 #>  #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"        "appifyr_number_input" inp_number(from = 0, to = 1e9) #> $fg #> [1] "number" #>  #> $label #> NULL #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $opts #> $opts$from #> [1] 0 #>  #> $opts$to #> [1] 1e+09 #>  #> $opts$step #> [1] 1 #>  #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"        "appifyr_number_input" inp_number(from = 1, to = 7, label = "This Is A Survey") #> $fg #> [1] "number" #>  #> $label #> [1] "This Is A Survey" #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $opts #> $opts$from #> [1] 1 #>  #> $opts$to #> [1] 7 #>  #> $opts$step #> [1] 1 #>  #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"        "appifyr_number_input" inp_number(from = 0, to = 1, step = 0.1, label = "Probability") #> $fg #> [1] "number" #>  #> $label #> [1] "Probability" #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $opts #> $opts$from #> [1] 0 #>  #> $opts$to #> [1] 1 #>  #> $opts$step #> [1] 0.1 #>  #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"        "appifyr_number_input"

code: inp_text() #> $fg #> [1] "text" #>  #> $label #> NULL #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"      "appifyr_text_input" inp_text(label = "Plot Title") #> $fg #> [1] "text" #>  #> $label #> [1] "Plot Title" #>  #> $width #> [1] 4 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"      "appifyr_text_input" inp_text(width = 6) #> $fg #> [1] "text" #>  #> $label #> NULL #>  #> $width #> [1] 6 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"      "appifyr_text_input" inp_text(label = "Description", width = 12) #> $fg #> [1] "text" #>  #> $label #> [1] "Description" #>  #> $width #> [1] 12 #>  #> $dots #> list() #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "appifyr_input"      "appifyr_text_input"
